main event: An observer noted a bright star-like object in Toledo, Ohio on January 6, 1956, that moved at a speed approximately three times that of the moon.
interesting points: The object appeared and disappeared at irregular intervals, roughly every 5 minutes., Small objects seemed to tumble out of the main object like sparks from a Roman Candle flare., Each of these smaller lights was visible for only 3-4 seconds., The observer had a telescope which allowed for closer observation of the lights., No photographs were taken during this observation.
sighted object: a bright star-like object with sparks emitting from it
witness description: a civilian observer who used a telescope to view the object
